reference.title: FLOOR function
reference.shortdesc: The FLOOR function rounds the specified number down, and returns the largest number that is less than or equal to the specified number.

section.p: The specified number must be a DOUBLE PRECISION number.

ul.li: If the specified number is NULL, the result of this function is NULL.
If the specified number is equal to a mathematical integer, the result of this function is the same as the specified number.
If the specified number is zero (0), the result of this function is zero.

section.p: The returned value is the largest (closest to positive infinity) double floating point value that is less than or equal to the specified number. The returned value is equal to a mathematical integer. The data type of the returned value is a DOUBLE PRECISION number.
